titles.title: United States-Korea Normalization Resolution of 2003
Expressing the sense of Congress that all United States Armed Forces should be withdrawn from South Korea and the United States should end its defense guarantee of South Korea.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

bill.summary: 2/13/2003--Introduced. United States-Korea Normalization Resolution of 2003 - Expresses the sense of Congress that U.S. troops should be withdrawn from South Korea and that the United States should end its defense guarantee of such country.
